name: Dr. Marcus Reid
role: Protagonist - Data Analyst at Atacama Private Observatory
core_wound: Was publicly humiliated in grad school when his dissertation on non-random cosmic background patterns was rejected as apophenia (seeing patterns in randomness). Now terrified of being wrong again.
wants: To be taken seriously by the scientific community - to prove his pattern recognition skills are valid
needs: To trust his own judgment even when the world dismisses him - to lead rather than hide
voice_markers: Uses precise technical language even in casual conversation
Self-deprecating humor as defense mechanism ('I'm probably wrong, but...')
Tends to speak in conditional statements ('It might be possible that...', 'One could argue...')
Long pauses before answering - overthinks responses
References obscure mathematical concepts when nervous
contradiction: Brilliant at seeing patterns others miss, but doubts every conclusion he reaches. Wants recognition but sabotages himself with excessive humility.
physical_description: Lean, disheveled dark hair, always slightly wrinkled clothes. Avoids eye contact. Hands constantly fidgeting with pens or data tablets.
